definition: lit. the falling of one leaf heralds the coming of autumn (idiom)/fig. a small sign can indicate a great trend/a straw in the wind
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
to miss/to yearn day and night
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
